title: Five dead, 37 injured after bus plunged down a precipice in Gerandi Ella
byline: Five persons have died when a bus veered off the road and toppled down a precipice early this morning (11) in Gerandi Ella in Ramboda along the Nuwara Eliya - Gampola main road, Police said.

title: Death toll in Gerandi Ella bus accident climbs to eight
byline: The death toll in the accident at Gerandi Ella in Ramboda this morning (11) when a bus veered off the road and toppled down a precipice on the Nuwara Eliya - Gampola main road has increased to eight, Police said.

title: Evening showers expected in several areas
byline: Showers or thundershowers will occur at several places in the Western, Sabaragamuwa, Central, Uva, Southern and Northern provinces and in the Ampara and Batticaloa districts after 1.00 p.m., the Department of Meteorology says.

title: Putin proposes direct peace talks with Ukraine after three years of war
byline: Russian President Vladimir Putin on Sunday proposed direct talks with Ukraine on May 15 in Istanbul that he said should be aimed at bringing a durable peace and eliminating the root causes of the war.

title: Gerandi Ella bus accident: Death toll rises to 15, over 20 hospitalised
byline: The death toll in the accident in Gerandi Ella, Ramboda this morning when a bus veered off the road and fell from a precipice along the Nuwara Eliya-Gampola main road has increased to 15, Police said.

title: World Mother’s Day celebrated today
byline: The World Mother’s Day is being observed today in Sri Lanka and across the world.

title: Special open visits allowed for prison inmates for Vesak
byline: The Department of Prisons has announced a special arrangement permitting open visits for inmates in view of Vesak Poya Day.

title: Popular actress Semini Iddamalgoda arrested by Welikada Police
byline: Popular actress Semini Iddamalgoda has been arrested by the Welikada Police.

title: Four arrested at BIA with foreign cigarettes worth Rs. 60mn
byline: Four individuals have been apprehended by Sri Lanka Customs officers along with a consignment of foreign-manufactured cigarettes valued at Rs. 60 million.

title: CEB Chairman Tilak Siyambalapitiya resigns
byline: The Chairman of the Ceylon Electricity Board (CEB) Dr. Tilak Siyambalapitiya has handed in his letter of resignation.

title: 16 dead, 35 injured in Gerandi Ella bus accident
byline: Police say 16 individuals are confirmed to have died in the accident that occurred in Gerandi Ella, Ramboda this morning.

title: Death toll in Gerandi Ella bus accident climbs to 21
byline: The death toll in the accident at Gerandi Ella in Ramboda this morning (11) when a bus veered off the road and toppled down a precipice on the Nuwara Eliya - Gampola main road has increased to 21, Police said.

title: Over 30,000 tourists arrive in first week of May
byline: The number of tourists who arrived in the country in the first week of May stood at 33,910, the Sri Lanka Tourism Development Authority has announced.

title: Elton John and Dua Lipa seek protection from AI
byline: Dua Lipa, Sir Elton John, Sir Ian McKellen and Florence Welch are among a list of stars calling on the prime minister to update copyright laws in a way that protects them from artificial intelligence.

title: Google will pay Texas $1.4B to settle claims the company collected users’ data without permission
byline: Google will pay $1.4 billion to Texas to settle claims the company collected users’ data without permission, the state’s attorney general announced Friday.

title: Govt. to pay Rs. 1 million each to families of victims of Gerandi Ella accident
byline: The government has decided to pay a compensation of Rs. 1 million to families of each individual who died in this morning’s bus accident in Gerandi Ella.

title: Gerandi Ella bus accident: Helicopters on standby to airlift those injured to Colombo
byline: Two Bell 412 helicopters have been kept on standby to airlift those injured in this morning’s bus accident in Gerandi Ella to Colombo, the Ministry of Defence said.

title: President offers condolences to families of victims of Gerandi Ella accident
byline: President Anura Kumara Dissanayake has extended his condolences to families of those who died in the bus accident that occurred in Gerandi Ella, Kotmale this morning (11).

title: Chinese passenger car sales rise for a third month in April
byline: China’s car sales in April rose for a third month, up 14.8% from a year earlier, as government-subsidised auto trade-ins mitigated the impact of U.S. tariffs on consumer sentiment.

title: Over 19,000 dengue cases reported in Sri Lanka so far this year
byline: A total of 19,215 dengue cases have been reported in the country so far this year, the National Dengue Control Unit (NDCU) has confirmed.

title: Asanga Abeyagoonasekera becomes first Sri Lankan appointed to Millennium Project Board
byline: The Millennium Project, a leading global think tank on future studies and foresight, has appointed Asanga Abeyagoonasekera to its Board of Directors as an Ex-officio member—marking the first time a Sri Lankan has joined the board.

title: COPA criticizes Railway Dept. for audit delays and inefficiency
byline: The Committee on Public Accounts (COPA) has uncovered that the Department of Railways had failed to submit audit reports properly for several years. Accordingly, the COPA has accused the department of serious inefficiency.

title: Actress Semini Iddamalgoda granted bail
byline: Popular actress Semini Iddamalgoda, who was arrested by the Welikada Police last evening (10), has been granted bail.

title: Pope Leo XIV appeals for ‘no more war’ in first Sunday message
byline: Pope Leo XIV appealed to the world’s major powers for “no more war” in his first Sunday message to crowds in St. Peter’s Square since his election as pontiff.

title: Special traffic plan in Colombo in view of Vesak
byline: Sri Lanka Police has announced the implementation of a special traffic plan in Colombo from tomorrow (12) in line with the 2025 Vesak Festival.

title: What caused the Gerandi Ella bus accident?
byline: Investigations are underway to determine whether the cause of the bus accident that occurred at Gerandi Ella in Kotmale this morning (11) was due to the driver’s negligence or due a technical defect in the bus, Police Media Spokesman, Senior Superintendent of Police (SSP) Buddhika Manatunga, said.

title: Fragile ceasefire holds between India, Pakistan as Trump offers more help
byline: A ceasefire between India and Pakistan was holding on Sunday after both sides blamed the other for initial violations, as U.S. President Donald Trump vowed to help the arch-rivals find a solution on the disputed Kashmir region.

title: Death toll in Gerandi Ella bus accident climbs to 22
byline: The death toll in the accident at Gerandi Ella in Ramboda this morning (11) when a bus veered off the road and toppled down a precipice on the Nuwara Eliya - Gampola main road has increased to 22, Police said.

title: President Dissanayake welcomes India-Pakistan ceasefire agreement
byline: The President of Sri Lanka, Anura Kumara Dissanayake, issued a statement today (11) welcoming the ceasefire agreement reached between India and Pakistan and reaffirmed the country’s unwavering support for continued dialogue.
